channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for CT
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for CT

item.title: Report X-2024010761
item.description:
Report X-2024010761

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-07T15:11:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-04
  • City: SOUTH WINDSOR
  • State: CT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found wet so it was placed into a hazmat bag lined bin. DescribePack: Package failed due to caps becoming loose and failing to contain contents. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: The package was promptly placed into a red hazmat bin to prevent further leakage.

item.title: Report X-2024010611
item.description:
Report X-2024010611

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-02T15:12:00+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-26
  • City: WILLINGTON
  • State: CT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Wet pkg placed on a rolling cart and staged by an open door near the HMPA. Inspection of pkg found a Kerosene heater in a carton with no Hazmat markings. No Hazmat Certification or OP-900LL Hazmat tags were provided to indicate Hazardous Materials inside the machine in the pkg. DescribePack: Loose cap on 1 x 15 gal fuel tank. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Pkg placed upright on rolling cart with absorbent pads under the pkg.
